Herbal Tea and Honey Remedy: Create a blend of herbs such as ginger, peppermint, and echinacea, known for their natural anti-inflammatory and decongestant properties. Steep the herbs in hot water and add honey to sweeten. Drink the tea several times a day to help alleviate symptoms.

Saltwater Gargle: Saltwater has antibacterial properties that can help reduce swelling in the throat and ease congestion. Mix 1/4 teaspoon of salt with 8 ounces of warm water and gargle several times a day to help soothe a sore throat.

Onion and Garlic Stew: Onions and garlic have natural antibacterial and antiviral properties that can help combat the common cold. Drink the mixture several times a day to help boost the immune system and reduce cold symptoms.

Neti Pot Rinse: Use a neti pot to rinse your nasal passages with a saline solution to help clear out mucus and reduce congestion. Mix 1/4 teaspoon of salt with 8 ounces of warm water and pour the solution into the neti pot. Tilt your head to one side and gently pour the solution into your nostril, allowing it to flow out the other nostril. Repeat several times a day.

Aromatherapy: Essential oils such as eucalyptus, peppermint, and tea tree oil have natural decongestant and anti-inflammatory properties. Add a few drops of these oils to a diffuser or inhale directly from a cloth or tissue. Breathe in the vapor to help ease congestion and reduce cold symptoms.
